title: Strengthening Service Quality Competency in Practice: E-Learning Course for Chronic Non-Cancer Pain Management

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can describe the six core modules required for assessing and managing chronic non-cancer pain patients
Learners can apply at least 80% of the 20 ACGME competency-based goals to real-world cases

Learners compare pharmacological (NSAIDs, opioids) and non-pharmacological (physical therapy, CBT) approaches across 3 pain management scenarios, develop personalized treatment plans (≥2 combined approaches) based on patient profiles (age, medical history, pain intensity), and score ≥80% on expert evaluation rubrics (clarity, appropriateness, safety)
Learners achieve at least 70% participation in collaborative learning with peers using interactive elements within e-learning modules
After completing the course, at least 80% of learners establish action plans for behavioral changes applicable to real educational settings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
